pullRequest.body:
Define the localization of a fractional ideal at a prime ideal, and prove some basic properties.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

This PR is part 3 out of 4 of a proof of `isDedekindDomain_iff_isDedekindDomainDvr`.
Part 4 is available here: #14242

- [x] depends on: #14099 Part 1
- [x] depends on: #14216 Part 2

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [bcfb91cad2](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14237/commits/bcfb91cad2f5ca180886b8bb730091fea5e76bbd)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.FractionalIdeal.LocalizedAtPrime`|1253|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Field.isLocalization_self`
`+ coe_localizedAtPrime`
`+ exists_smul_mem_of_mem_localizedAtPrime`
`+ instance : IsFractionRing Aₚ K`
`+ instance : IsLocalizedModule P.primeCompl (I.localizedAtPrimeInclusion P)`
`+ instance : IsScalarTower A Aₚ K`
`+ localizedAtPrime`
`+ localizedAtPrimeInclusion`
`+ localizedAtPrimeInclusion_mk`
`+ localizedAtPrime_add`
`+ localizedAtPrime_div`
`+ localizedAtPrime_div_le`
`+ localizedAtPrime_eq_zero_iff`
`+ localizedAtPrime_inv`
`+ localizedAtPrime_mul`
`+ localizedAtPrime_ne_zero`
`+ localizedAtPrime_one`
`+ localizedAtPrime_zero`
`+ mem_localizedAtPrime`
`+ mem_localizedAtPrime_iff`
`+ not_le_of_localizedAtPrime_eq_one`
`+ self_subset_localizedAtPrime`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:

```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#14099~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#14216~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Thanks! The results look good, nicely stated and a good coverage of the requirements. I'm still thinking a bit about the proofs, some of them feel like a lot of manual work, but perhaps that's unavoidable with the current state of the library.

Thanks! The results look good, nicely stated and a good coverage of the requirements. I'm still thinking a bit about the proofs, some of them feel like a lot of manual work, but perhaps that's unavoidable with the current state of the library.

```suggestion
* `FractionalIdeal.coe_localizedAtPrime`: The localization of `I` is `Submodule.span Aₚ I`.
* `FractionalIdeal.localizedAtPrime_add`: Localizing commutes with addition.
* `FractionalIdeal.localizedAtPrime_mul`: Localizing commutes with multiplication.
* `FractionalIdeal.localizedAtPrime_div`: Localizing commutes with division for finitely-generated denominator.
* `FractionalIdeal.localizedAtPrime_inv`: Localizing commutes with inverses for finitely-generated `I`.
* `FractionalIdeal.not_le_of_localizedAtPrime_eq_one`: If `I.localizedAtPrime P = 1`, then `¬ I ≤ P`.
```
I feel like this should be a `private` lemma rather than `local notation`!

```suggestion
def localizedAtPrimeInclusion : I →ₗ[A] I.localizedAtPrime P where
```
or
```suggestion
def localizedAtPrime.inclusion : I →ₗ[A] I.localizedAtPrime P where
```

```suggestion
variable {P} in
theorem mem_localizedAtPrime {x : K} : x ∈ I.localizedAtPrime P ↔
```

```suggestion
@[simp] theorem localizedAtPrime_inv (hI : I.coeToSubmodule.FG) :
    I⁻¹.localizedAtPrime P = (I.localizedAtPrime P)⁻¹ := by
```

```suggestion
  exact (s_eq_p ▸ Subtype.coe_prop s) hp
```

That's a useful theorem! We already have [IsLocalization.at_units](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/Localization/Basic.html#IsLocalization.at_units) which contains most of the statement but replacing nonzero elements with units, so the proof can be shortened to:
```suggestion
theorem Field.isLocalization_self {K : Type*} [Field K] {M : Submonoid K} (hM : 0 ∉ M) :
    IsLocalization M K :=
  .at_units _ (fun x _ => IsUnit.mk0 _ (by rintro rfl; contradiction))
```

This got renamed :)
```suggestion
* `FractionalIdeal.localizedAtPrime`: The localization of a fractional ideal at a prime ideal.
```

One thing to remark on here is that the library tends to prefer `IsLocalization.AtPrime` over `Localization.AtPrime` and `IsFractionRing` over `FractionRing`. It does make everything more verbose, but it helps in cases where we know a specific value for the localization. For example, `FractionRing ℤ` is not the same thing as `ℚ`. So you would end up inserting a lot of coercions and isomorphisms to identify the different localizations.

I expect in this case it's okay since we're treating `localizedAtPrime` as a new construction operating on a pair `(Ideal, FractionalIdeal)`, so we don't need to insert so many explicit isomorphisms. What is your experience with using these results in your follow-up work?

I wanted to define it in greater generality, but I couldn't find an easy way to get it to work. If I recall correctly, the problem was that `K` needs to be an `Aₚ`-algebra, which can't (currently) be inferred when they're defined using `IsFractionRing` and `IsLocalization`.

To answer the other question, the only follow-up work I did with this was the proof of `isDedekindDomain ↔ isDedekindDomainDvr` linked above. In that specific case, being stuck with `FractionRing` rather than `IsFractionRing` didn't cause any problems.

> I wanted to define it in greater generality, but I couldn't find an easy way to get it to work. If I recall correctly, the problem was that `K` needs to be an `Aₚ`-algebra, which can't (currently) be inferred when they're defined using `IsFractionRing` and `IsLocalization`.

Is the issue that we are missing some instances? Can you switch to the `Is` point of view and add them, or give some idea about problems which you can't solve using the `Is` approach?

Let's add a little lemma for evaluating the definition, in line with `Subset.inclusion_mk`:
```suggestion

@[simp] lemma localizedAtPrime_inclusion_mk {x : K} (hx : x ∈ I) :
    localizedAtPrime_inclusion P I ⟨x, hx⟩ = ⟨x, self_subset_localizedAtPrime _ _ hx⟩ := by
  simp [localizedAtPrime_inclusion]
  
```

Following a `rw` with a `rfl` suggests that your rewrite lemmas are not quite powerful enough. Here, `localizedAtPrime_inclusion_mk` is exactly what we need:
```suggestion
    ⟨⟨⟨s • x, sxI⟩, ⟨s, sP⟩⟩, (localizedAtPrime_inclusion_mk _ _ _).symm⟩
```
More like a note to self: It feels like all these rewriting steps should be doable in a simpler way. Can we figure out a normal form for these expressions that `simp` can produce reliably?

I couldn't figure out a good way to do it. Writing the theorem using `mk 1 s • i` was already my attempt at using something that could be considered a normal form, but it doesn't want to play nice with the simplifier.

It's possible to extract the first six rewrites (which the two `congr` subgoals have in common) into a separate lemma. I'm not sure whether the lemma is interesting enough to be worthwhile. That might partly depend on whether we decide to redo this whole file in greater generality with `IsLocalization` and `IsFractionRing`.

As an aside, the `congr 1` doesn't do anything important -- the proof still works without it. I think it's nice to have it in there for now while we're discussing how to simplify the code, but we could remove it later.

Here's a strengthening of the result (found by noticing that the proof of `localizedAtPrime_ne_zero` starts by doing the contrapositive).
```suggestion
theorem localizedAtPrime_eq_zero_iff : I.localizedAtPrime P = 0 ↔ I = 0 := by
  constructor
  · rw [eq_zero_iff, eq_zero_iff]
    intro h x xI
    exact h _ (self_subset_localizedAtPrime _ _ xI)
  · rintro rfl
    simp

variable (P)

theorem localizedAtPrime_ne_zero (hI : I ≠ 0) : I.localizedAtPrime P ≠ 0 :=
  mt localizedAtPrime_eq_zero_iff.mp hI
```

```suggestion
    (I * J).localizedAtPrime P = I.localizedAtPrime P * J.localizedAtPrime P :=
```
and everywhere else

pullRequest.title: feat: Define the localization of a fractional ideal at a prime ideal

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: simple lemmas about fractional ideals
[Merged by Bors] - feat(Mathlib.RingTheory.FractionalIdeal.Extended): Define extensions of fractional ideals
